abstract: Portugal’s credit rating was cut two notches on Tuesday by Moody’s Investors’ Service, lending urgency to the discussions of European Union finance ministers about how banks would be affected if a government were to default on its debts.
snippet: Portugal’s credit rating was cut two notches on Tuesday by Moody’s Investors’ Service, lending urgency to the discussions of European Union finance ministers about how banks would be affected if a government were to default on its debts.
lead_paragraph: Portugal’s credit rating was cut two notches on Tuesday by Moody’s Investors’ Service, lending urgency to the discussions of European Union finance ministers about how banks would be affected if a government were to default on its debts, The New York Times’s James Kanter reported.
